messageBody:
How can I test asynchronous calls using JUnit?

For example: I have a method that invokes another method
asynchronously.

class Client //implements various interfaces
{
String outputXML;

void makeServerCall(String inputXML)
{
server.executeAsynCall(inputXML);
}

// registered for listening back from
// server once the asyn call is executed
void onMessage(Message msg)
{
outputXML = msg.getData();
}

String getOutput()
{
return outputXML;
}
}

In my test case, I write:

public void testOutput()
{
clientObj.makeServerCall(inputXML);
//String expectedOutputXML = blah blah;
assertTrue(expectedOutputXML.equals(clientObj.getOutput()));
}

This invariably fails, because the getOutput would return anything
but the expected output, as long as the onMessage is not executed.
(NOTE: onMessage is registered with the middle-ware, so that once
the server returns with the output, this method is invoked).

Can I use JUnit for such a scenario? If 'Yes', how? If 'No', what
other frameworks are there to be able to test such scenarios.

Thanks,
Kalyan.
